update.description:
This is a portion of pull request #907 that is being resubmitted as a smaller pull request. It improves support for SimbodyUniversalJoint and adds a universal joint test. @hsu is the original author; I just repackaged the pull request to make it a bit smaller.

EDIT:

I forgot to mention that this fixes a bug in ODE's implementation of the universal joint (#991).
update.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.html: I'll tackle reference frames in #494

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw:
you're right, the reference frame stuff is not related to the enums.  I guess I meant to say:

*the addition of enums made the ambiguities of reference frames definitions for returns of `GetAxis()` function calls more obvious...*

Which means it's a good addition  :-)
content.html:
you're right, the reference frame stuff is not related to the enums. I guess I meant to say:

the addition of enums made the ambiguities of reference frames definitions for returns of GetAxis() function calls more obvious...

Which means it's a good addition :-)

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw: The enum doesn't change the behavior of the API's, it just makes it easier to map the joint index (0, 1) to the axes that are fixed to the parent link and the child link.
content.html: The enum doesn't change the behavior of the API's, it just makes it easier to map the joint index (0, 1) to the axes that are fixed to the parent link and the child link.

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw:
With the addition of enums, does this mean `GetAxis(AXIS_PARENT)` returns the axis in the parent link frame while `GetAxis(AXIS_CHILD)` returns the axis in the child frame?

It's unclear to me in the case of severe joint constraint violation, what will `GetAxis(AXIS_PARENT) return, i.e. what frames do ODE keep the axis.
content.html:
With the addition of enums, does this mean GetAxis(AXIS_PARENT) returns the axis in the parent link frame while GetAxis(AXIS_CHILD) returns the axis in the child frame?

It's unclear to me in the case of severe joint constraint violation, what will `GetAxis(AXIS_PARENT) return, i.e. what frames do ODE keep the axis.

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw: The implementation in ODE does not match that of the [documentation picture](http://www.ode.org/ode-latest-userguide.html#sec_7_3_4).  Without the flip, axis1 and axis2 are backwards.
content.html: The implementation in ODE does not match that of the documentation picture. Without the flip, axis1 and axis2 are backwards.

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw: I added an enum in f10410b that may clarify this a bit
content.html: I added an enum in f10410b that may clarify this a bit

pull_request.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

pullrequest.title: Fix SimbodyUniversalJoint and add test for universal joints

content.raw: I just added an enum to UniversalJoint to make it easier to identify which joint axis is fixed to which link. (f10410b)
content.html: I just added an enum to UniversalJoint to make it easier to identify which joint axis is fixed to which link. (f10410b)
